fields.description:
When I try to upgrade our existing Bamboo 2.1.5 instance to version 2.2, the database upgrade fails with the following error message:

2009-03-11 09:58:34,059 INFO [main] [UpgradeLauncher] Current data is at build number: 1009. Upgrade required. Firing upgrade manager...
2009-03-11 09:58:34,102 INFO [main] [UpgradeManagerImpl] Found 2 high priority upgrade tasks
2009-03-11 09:58:34,103 INFO [main] [UpgradeManagerImpl] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2009-03-11 09:58:34,103 INFO [main] [UpgradeManagerImpl] Running upgrade task 1101 : Converting Notification Rules to be one recipient per rule
2009-03-11 09:58:34,103 INFO [main] [UpgradeManagerImpl] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2009-03-11 09:58:34,369 INFO [main] [UpgradeTask1101NotificationRecipients] Converting Notification Rules for MBADMIN-PGBACKUP
2009-03-11 09:58:34,370 INFO [main] [UpgradeTask1101NotificationRecipients] Converting Rule: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.system.notifications:buildCompleted.failedBuilds,
2009-03-11 09:58:34,399 ERROR [main] [UpgradeTask1101NotificationRecipients] Unable to update notifications: ERROR: operator does not exist: bigint = character varying
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: operator does not exist: bigint = character varying
fields.summary: Update 2.1.5 to 2.2 fails with PostgreSQL database: operator does not exist

fields.description:
For IDE Connectors we need the following info exposed in a regular way (with a kosher REST API)
- all info a specific build (something like getBuild(project, plankey, buildnumber) ) and not only for the last build from given plan or last X builds (like it's now)
- "failing since..." information (or: getLastPassed)
- "fixed in" information (for an old failed build)
- getNewFailedTests
- info about current activities (i.e.. queued builds waiting for executing and build being executed)
- build logs of given build which is currently being build (the same functionality which ajaxy js in Bamboo web UI uses to show log of a build which is currently being built). Ideally obtained in a loseless way (i.e. if we periodically poll for current output we will have a guarantee to retrieve complete build log without any holes)

I am putting everything in one bucket. Feel free to split it into as many separate issues as you wish.
Let Edwin prioritise which is of the greatest importance.
For me: build logs of builds currently being built look the most interesting, as I would love to have in IDE the following functionality:
Execute given build and then immediately see in the console its progress and output (clickable of course)
fields.summary: New remote API functionalities

fields.description:
Please refer to: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=32517&tstart=0 for a concrete use-case.

There are a few aspects to this problem.

h4. Bamboo should not FAIL the build if Clover optimizes all tests away
A flag could be added to the test-result GLOB input field, with the option to 'fail if missing'.

h4. Test Optimization means that Bamboo's expected build times are wrong.
Bamboo could communicate with Clover (parsing the logs, or via some other mechanism) to better estimate build times. Clover already reports to the logs how much testing time it expects to save.
fields.summary: Make Bamboo aware of Test Optimization builds

This should be set by default and overridden or removed by the user if necessary.

attach the atlassian-bamboo.log log file found in your application home.
We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Build Date: 3/02/2009

fields.description:
Ever since we moved everything over to plugins (e.g repository plugin, build strategy plugin) the build configuration tree is no longer being cleared properly.  E.g if you change your build configuration to use SVN from CVS, your CVS details will still be stored in the configuration.  This has the nice side effect that it seems that Bamboo "remembers" your configuration, but is probably not ideal.

The bug: the code searches for the full plugin key in config xml but the plugin key is not used as the xml tag/identifier so nothing is found/deleted. See ConfigureBuildRepository
fields.summary: Build Definition XML does not clear unused parameters

fields.description:
When an elastic instance/agent is configured to mount a ebs volume containing a snapshot during startup the progress/success/fail should be fed back to bamboo server for display.
the log in /tmp/setupEbsSnapshot.log could be used to process progress and results.
fields.summary: Talkback from elastic agent to bamboo server to include EBS volume mount results

fields.description:
We currently have API for adding comments, however I was not able to find any API for fetching existing comments (also from other users).
New Bamboo has also capability of creating virtual chat rooms around build comments. This API obviously should expose also these comments (send via IM).

This feature is needed by Eclipse and IntelliJ Connector.
fields.summary: Bamboo REST API should expose functionality to retrieve all comments for selected build

fields.description: It is not uncommon that we have builds that run for way too long, and never complete.  It should be the case that Bamboo alerts someone, at a minimum.  I am sure there are other things that could or should happen, but notification is a good first step.
fields.summary: Builds should be able to have a configurable timeout threshold

fields.description: We would like some users to be notified only on passing builds.  They are not interested in failing builds.
fields.summary: On successful build only notification

fields.description: The artifact redirect for latest artifacts only apply to top the top level artifact directory, i.e. http://<Bamboo>/download/PLAN_KEY/artifacts/LATEST/<Artifact_Name> and you can't reference specific artifacts within the root <artifact_Name> directory, i.e http://<Bamboo>/download/PLAN_KEY/artifacts/LATEST/<Artifact_Name>/my_fancy_file.txt
fields.summary: CLONE -The LATEST URL redirect(s) only apply to top level artifacts.

fields.description: Essentially when running the remote agent wrapper on windows without setting your own bamboo.home variable. It will die.  It seems that the generated home location is not quoted so any spaces cause havoc.
fields.summary: Remote Agent Wrapper does not quote the bamboo home

fields.description:
Occasionally there may be transient problems communicating with the AWS. This causes the state of the Instance to be changed into UNKNOWN, which automatically brings down the instance according to Bamboo.

We should be more tolerant of transient errors. We should mark UNKNOWN as a temporary state and only switching it to TERMINATED once a certain threshold of errors have been received.

An example is this error appearing on J2BAC after running for around 9 days. New agents can be restarted without any dramas.

{quote}
com.xerox.amazonws.ec2.EC2Exception: Problem parsing returned message.

fields.summary: "UNKNOWN" states returned from AWS should be more tolerant of errors

fields.description:
Currently only  "custom.p4.revision.number" is available.

It would be great if bamboo's perforce module could additionally provide:

- custom.p4.port - Perforce server as specified in the plan configuration
- custom.p4.client - Perforce clientname (workspace) as specified in the plan configuration
- custom.p4.username - Perforce username as specified in the plan configuration
- custom.p4.revision.previous - The change set number of the previous build (or 0 for initial builds). 

We have a number of tests that work directly on the perforce-depot (e.g. doing commit statistics, checks etc.).
Without those variables we would have to specify them a second time (e.g. in the plan's builder arguments).

In addition it would be great to also have global variables for:
- buildForceClean - The flag "Force Clean Build"
- buildTimeStamp - The build's start time
- projectKey - From "Plan Details"
- projectName - From "Plan Details"
fields.summary: Provide more build-specific variables

fields.description:
no action is performed on bamboo server.
The client that triggered the build displays {quote}A build of Remote - Does Not Work was triggered by remote http call. {quote}
fields.summary: remote api build trigger updateAndBuild.action?buildKey=XXX-YYY does not work

fields.description:
When bamboo server first accesses an elastic instance it checks for the existence of
* elasticbamboo security group (to allow http and ssh access)
* elasticbamboo key pair 

If not present the security group is created and the key pair is generated. The server then stores the elasticbamboo.pk file in bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk. This copy is only available once after creation.

If another bamboo server is installed it will not have the bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk file available.

Still, Bamboo assumes that this file is present in it's own home under bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk to be used for the ssh command line in the admin/elastic/viewElasticInstance.action screen.

The existence of this file should be checked and a description should be displayed on how and where to get/generate this file if it is missing.

The file can be copied over from the bamboo instance that _first_ registered with the AWS account or the existing key pair has to be deleted in the [aws console|https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2]
The next time bamboo boots up an instance in ec2 it will generate the key pair and store elasticbamboo,pk file in its home.

Hugh!
fields.summary: Help text for SSH to Instance link should be more informative if private key is missing

fields.description:
It's generating way too much logging, right down to HTTP packet dumps.

Affects both the new wrapped agent, and the legacy agent.
fields.summary: Initial logging level of Remote Agent is DEBUG

fields.description:
The link indicated in the attachment uses the Base URL, rather than being relative to the current URL, which may have a different host address.

Because of this, clicking on it initially redirects the user to the login screen.
fields.summary: Link from EB configuration to Agents configuration when Remote Agents are disabled uses Base URL, rather than relative URL

fields.description:
To indicate the reason _why_ (comment) a plan is disabled and _who_ (user) disabled/enabled it?

It would be great value to us with a distributed team if we could understand who has disabled a plan, and why they have done so.
fields.summary: Bamboo to keep track of build enable/disable history with username and comments

fields.description:
The build results page is very slow to generate when there are large numbers of test failures.

We have a build failing with 543 test failures (due to some seriously broken code) - the resulting page is 600k in size, and takes 60-90 seconds to generate.
Our response times for typical results pages are in the order of 1-2 seconds, and server load is not high.

Testing this after a restart did not improve response times - i.e. it's not a memory exhaustion problem.

(Punitive slowing of results pages for large numbers of failures could be viewed as a feature I guess).
fields.summary: Build results page is very slow to generate with large numbers of test failures

fields.description:
this particular method uses a different structure and even different names to display similar information.  This should be changed to use the template provided in the macros.ftl similar to the other get-build-results api calls.

However, this will break any scripts already using this functionality.
fields.summary: "getLatestUserBuilds" REST method returns an inconsistent representation of a build result.

fields.description:
It would be nice if I could get some kind of information about a build that is currently running beyond just tailing the build log.

Theoretical implementation:

* Admin setting up build chooses "log filters" (need a better name) for their builds
* Each filter is a Java class that receives every line of the log generated by that build.
* Filters can place key-value pairs in a session, and give some kind of indication of whether the build has already failed or not.
* This data is displayed somehow above the log in the running build display

For example, the "Surefire filter" greps each line for "Tests run: \{x}, Failures: \{y}, Errors: \{z}" and accumulates the running sum of the numbers so someone watching the build can see how far into the tests we are, and how many have failed already. If y or z are non-zero it flags the build as having already failed (this won't stop the build, just give the viewer some indication that something has gone wrong already)
fields.summary: Provide summary information about still-running build

fields.description:
see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-3572
doc link http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+EAR-WAR+Installation+Guide
fields.summary: for WAR deployment warn users of growing catalina.out

fields.description:
Please document the options available to indicate how to setup release management worklow. It should include the option to create groups with appropriate permissions (ie broaden the permissions with each step) and use bulk change plan permissions. It should also link to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMEXT/Release+Management+and+Deployment

Here is the use case of an example customer to guide the documentation:

'We build nightly and we need a way of indicating who can access which builds. Basically, the developers should have access to all builds. Once the developers are happy, they issue a build to QA. Once QA is happy, we then release the build "into the wild".'
fields.summary: Document workflow / release management options

fields.description:
Please document the options for users to integrate Bamboo with a project that uses custom build numbers. Here is an example:

"We currently use our own build numbers (based on the number of days since Jan 1st 2000). These build numbers are written into our software. Can Bamboo support custom build numbers?"
fields.summary: Document how to integrate with projects using custom build ids or numbers

fields.description:
We have a number of plans/builds we have termed as "official".  These are slower and do more operations than our CI builds.

We typically run official builds only overnight, and they take over an hour.

Analyzing the builds, we have determined that almost half this time is spent building help files, which vary little between daily runs, and are typically not critical when we are wishing to get a midday "official" build turned out.

What we would like is some property that differentiates between a scheduled build and a user initiated build, so we can skip the help compile during midday/user initiated builds.

This may already exist, and I just don't know where to get it, but we already property the build-number.txt file that bamboo generates, and this would be a natural location for us to grab this piece of data.
fields.summary: Differentiate between daily and user initiated builds

fields.description:
When we recieve email from Bamboo, we'd like the email subjects to be rearranged, such that the most important info is listed first.

Here is the current email as we get it now:

[Bamboo] Symyx Notebook - 6.2 Notebook and Vault Packaging CI build 97 has FAILED

This is based on this setup:

%PREFIX% %PROJECT% - %PLAN% %BUILDNUMBER% %SUCCESS%

While less readable, but much more effective for us would be to have the info in this order:

%PREFIX% %SUCCESS% %PLAN% %BUILDNUMBER% %PROJECT%

One approach would be to make subject formatting administrator customizable

However, an easier approach would be to simply change the default.  Perhaps other customers would benefit from this, or maybe they would not like it.  I know our users would rather have the useful bits of info first.
fields.summary: Email subjects should be rearranged

fields.description:
Firefox displays an incorrect character in report data tables 
!srep1.jpg!

In IE7 it is still incorrect but looks better.
!srep2.jpg!
fields.summary: Invalid character in report data tables

fields.description: The blue background looks a bit weird on the general configuration when you have the confirmation message, see pic.
fields.summary: Weird Panelling on General Configuration Updated

fields.description:
Bamboo should have a feature to automatically generate release notes of a build consisting of the subversion commit messages, including jira tickets numbers, and comments associated with the jira ticket.

Generating some plain text, html, or pdf would be nice to package with a given release, but incorporating all this to have in confluence would also be good.

One option would be to retrieve the release notes via a remote api method.
fields.summary: Create and publish release notes from within bamboo

fields.description:

fields.description:
As distributed, Bamboo's log4j.properties file directs INFO level output to both atlassian-bamboo.log and "console" which, in Tomcat, is the catalina.out file. While the "atlassian-bamboo.log" file is configured to be a RollingFileAppender, the "catalina.out" file is not, and it grows very quickly. Since detailed information is being logged to "atlassian-bamboo.log", it probably doesn't also need to appear in "catalina.out". I have modified Bamboo's log4j.properties file to change this line:

log4j.rootLogger=INFO, console, filelog 

to: 

log4j.rootLogger=INFO, filelog 

I recommend that you consider making this configuration, or something like it, the default for future distributions.
fields.summary: Reduce output logged to Tomcat's catalina.out

fields.description:
Bamboo considers the acronym for 8bit Unicode Transformation Format to be a JIRA issue:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090218-qgxtkh2qa1j6ntyfdpe6uduaej.jpg!

Perhaps what could be done is to get a list of all valid JIRA project keys and only match those, rather than any non-whitespace uppercase alphabetical string followed by a dash and a number.
fields.summary: Bamboo considers UTF-8 as a JIRA issue when found in commit messages

Once BEAC is using 1.6.1, we need to copy all the crowd cache configuration information into the ehcache.xml file and make sure contegix does not overwrite it when they do upgrades.

fields.description: Instead of svnkit using default Subversion credentials storage you may consider using BasicAuthenticationManager class (pass its instance to SVNClientManager.newInstance(...) method when instantiating SVNClientManager. When constructing BasicAuthenticationManager you'll have to pass credentials that are stored by Bamboo in its own credentials storage. Then SVNKit will not use any sort of persistent credentials storage and will only take credentials that have been passed to BasicAuthenticationManager.
fields.summary: Bamboo to pass its own credentials storage to SVNKIT

fields.description: Every time I edit a plan details the "Test results Directory" gets its default value "**/test-reports/*.xml" instead of the value that I wrote the last time I edited it "test/reports/*.xml".
fields.summary: Test results Directory gets overwritten when changing plan settings

fields.description:
There are a few inefficiencies in the way we are currently using the EC2 web services:

- When we start multiple instances simultaneously, we are making a separate request for each, rather than a single request for multiple instances.
- We are polling for the status of each instance separately, rather than using a single call.
- We are polling for the status of volumes attached to each instance separately, rather than using a single call.

We can increase the scalability of Elastic Bamboo by replacing these multiple per-instance calls with more efficient multiple-instance calls.
fields.summary: Improve scalability of EC2 web service calls

fields.description:
When I tried to get Bamboo to build on a subversion branch, the admin screen rejected a valid URL (taken from TortoiseSVN repo-browser screen).  This is a deal breaker. If we can't build on a branch, Bamboo is useless to us.

URL: http://dfpcmsbos02:7804/svn/CashAvail/branches/cashavail-bam-poc
Bamboo error message:
This is not a valid Subversion Repository: svn: Processing PROPFIND request response failed: Premature end of file. (/svn/CashAvail/branches/cashavail-bam-poc) svn: PROPFIND request failed on '/svn/CashAvail/branches/cashavail-bam-poc'
fields.summary: Bamboo rejects SVN URLs on branches

fields.description:
Any plugin that needs configuration more than simple key value pairs that can be entered using a simple form on the web interface has a very difficult time currently.  For example, the JMeter Aggregator plugin allows a user to configure multiple assertions to run over the build results.  The configuration for this is currently implemented painfully in javascript, which dynamically adds new fields to the form for configuration.  Deleting assertions is particularly difficult because there is no way to remove a key out of the Bamboo configuration once it has been put in there.  There are a few possibilities that would make plugin developers lives a whole let easier:

* Allow build processor plugins to control what gets stored, rather than just storing everything that comes in from the web request.  Other than for validation, plugins cannot intercept or manipulate the data that gets sent when the configuration screen is saved.
* Allow build processor plugins to be configured in multiple steps, similar to the way notifications are configured.
* Provide an interface for allowing generic web components to easily modify build configuration.  This would allow plugins to have an advanced configuration screen for doing more powerful things.
fields.summary: Allow plugins to have more powerful build configuration

fields.description:
If license registration fails for an agent, we should kill it from the list. Otherwise it'll just sit there.

!http://img.skitch.com/20090212-xmfirm19rjihnr614uxsp3k7w1.png!
fields.summary: License registration failure should remove EC2 agent from "Pending" mode

fields.description:
A section in the admin > sysinfo screen should be added to display bamboo version and build id number for support requests.
This is helpful in case the customer does not bother or makes a mistake selecting the current bamboo version.
fields.summary: Support improvement : Add bamboo version and distribution info to System info screen

fields.description: It would be nice to have the capability to search for a group and sort them on the manage groups screen.  We are connecting Bamboo to Crowd which is connected to Active Directory.  Listing the groups takes a long time if there are a lot of them.  We have about 20 pages of groups and it takes about 30 seconds to load each page.  Since the group names are not sorted it takes a long time to find the group you are looking for, especially if it is on page 20.
fields.summary: Add searching capability to the Manage Groups screen

fields.description:
Elastic agent is not unregistered when elastic instance is being shutdown manually, ie. using AWS console or 'telinit 0' command.

The visual effect is that there are no instances (on Instances screen) but the agent is still visible on Agents screen.
fields.summary: Elastic agent not unregistered when instance is being killed manually

fields.description:
I would be great if bamboo would use fisheye to display the changes for each build.

Currenty I only see the perforce description and the author (no hyperlink to fisheye browser or the ability to see the changes files, diffs etc)
I would like to see the integration as in JIRA with all the details, links and the list of files.

After the build has finished, I can select Bamboo's 'Changes'-Tab and see all Changes with all files.
Here it would be great to have the JIRA-style display with collapse/expand. 

Sometimes we have changelists with 1000 files affected, which cannot be browsed this way.
fields.summary: Perforce FishEye linking

fields.summary: Detect that an agent hasn't started loading on Instance

fields.description:
On certain *nix based system, the SSH command may fail if you the PK file's permission is too open.

You may need to make the file only readable by the owner

{noformat}
[nmenere@atlassian20 ~]$ ssh -i /home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk root@ec2-174-129-156-13.compute-1.amazonaws.com
The authenticity of host 'ec2-174-129-156-13.compute-1.amazonaws.com (174.129.156.13)' can't be established.
RSA key fingerprint is 5e:6d:c7:ad:2d:e4:e2:d2:48:5f:05:65:11:e9:db:99.
Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)? yes
Warning: Permanently added 'ec2-174-129-156-13.compute-1.amazonaws.com,174.129.156.13' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@         WARNING: UNPROTECTED PRIVATE KEY FILE!          @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
Permissions 0644 for '/home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk' are too open.
It is recommended that your private key files are NOT accessible by others.
This private key will be ignored.
bad permissions: ignore key: /home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk
Enter passphrase for key '/home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk': 
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@         WARNING: UNPROTECTED PRIVATE KEY FILE!          @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
Permissions 0644 for '/home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk' are too open.
It is recommended that your private key files are NOT accessible by others.
This private key will be ignored.
bad permissions: ignore key: /home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk
Enter passphrase for key '/home/jira2-bamboo-j2ee/bamboo-home/xml-data/configuration/elasticbamboo.pk': 
{noformat}
fields.summary: Need to doc that the SSH command may fail if you don't have correct permissions on the file

fields.description:
Nick (& Mike as well) struggled with all these ids of various concepts that's shown on the UI.

I think we might need to have some sort of "inline" help (What's this?) everywhere. It's pretty confusing for people when they click around. Struggling with differentiating the many ideas isn't all that easy... MIght be worth working with Andrew / UI to see how exactly we can differentiate:

* EC2 Image
* EC2 Instance
* EC2 Volume
* Bamboo Server
* Bamboo Elastic agent

Not sure what we want to do about this (thus no estimate) whether we want to put (?) everywhere that goes to docs
fields.summary: Better inline contextual help

fields.description:
Notes from discussion ...

The increasing number of builds if producing an exponential amount of build data.  These are currently kept uncompressed and taking up a huge amount of disk space.  Please enable Gzip compression of this data.
fields.summary: Compress build artifacts and logs

fields.description:
it would be useful for me to be able to filter, or search build plans.

For example for each project, we have up to three plans. ("regular", daily, and up to two database script plans) I may be only interested in failed builds for our qa database envoronment, or only our daily builds. Since we have many projects the plans can take up several screens of information.
fields.summary: Ability to filter plans
Restarting Remote Agent in wrapper causes license issues with 1 Remote Agent licenses

fields.description:
For reasons that aren't currently clear (or important) to me, some of our builds are failing their svn up commands.  Eg:

{noformat}
[j2ee@atlassian25 CONFFUNC-T5M5T]$ svn up
svn: Can't open file 'confluence-websphere-test/.svn/text-base/pom.xml.svn-base': No such file or directory
[j2ee@atlassian25 CONFFUNC-T5M5T]$ svn up && echo "up succeeded"
svn: Can't open file 'confluence-websphere-test/.svn/text-base/pom.xml.svn-base': No such file or directory
[j2ee@atlassian25 CONFFUNC-T5M5T]$ 
{noformat}

Bamboo attempted the builds anyway, without reporting the subversion problems anywhere I could see.  (The builds failed due to a pom file that hadn't been upped, so we spent a while thinking it was maven's fault).
fields.summary: "Can't open file" error causes build to not be run

fields.description: What is the easiest way to do this:  I have defined a group, within they have plans and builds.  This same group now needs a second "project" for different builds and plans.  They want the ability to log in and choose whichever project, and after selecting project 1 or project 2, they see their builds only for the project they choose.
fields.summary: 2 projects for each log on user?
